content: Is TB being run on a Mobile, Tablet or Computer?

content: Computer
creator: wrangler53

content:
Although Mobile Apps often include the previous correspondence with the email, I wasn't aware that TB on a Computer did this - and can't find a setting.

However, did you mean that several emails in a list of correspondence are listed line by line rather than as one? If so, have you accidentally clicked on the Thread Toggle (attachment)?
creator: frisée

content:
Thank you for responding. Much appreciated. Your reference to a "Thread toggle" provided a clue. Initially I did not know what you were referring to as I had never seen a Thread toggle. Eventually I found the setting for it. After a lot of experimenting I finally wound up with a display that groups together emails with a lot of responses to the same subject at the top of the email list under the Subject heading with the toggle symbol and a carrot to expand/collapse the group. Annoyingly the groups are not displayed chronologically and the expanded groups are displayed in ascending order. New emails are entered before the groups putting the groups between previous emails with no thread and new emails. Really poor and confusing display. This display is not what I hade before but at least now with the responses grouped I do not have all the individual responses displayed along with all the other emails.

My original display had only the original email with the return symbol (left arrow). My reply was not displayed and there was no "group" sign. All emails were displayed in chronological order. Have no idea why the sudden change. I had not made any changes to Thunderbird's settings. Was there some recent update that I am not aware of?

Bye the way on one of my experiments with different settings I got a display that listed the number of emails received during a specified time period e.g., "n" email 2 days ago, "n" emails 7 days ago, etc.. No idea how what settings were used and have not been able to recreate it.
creator: wrangler53

content:
Wrangler53 said
Bye the way on one of my experiments with different settings I got a display that listed the number of emails received during a specified time period e.g., "n" email 2 days ago, "n" emails 7 days ago, etc.. No idea how what settings were used and have not been able to recreate it.

Please see "Feature for Focus: Grouped by Sort" section in the following link: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2024/10/maximize-your-day-focus-your-inbox-with-grouped-by-sort/
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

At this point, I really hate Thunderbird. It use to be awesome. It seems that each "improvement" makes it worse.

OK, het gaat dus om de accountwachtwoorden en niet het hoofdwachtwoord. Als u die wachtwoorden niet meer weet, kunt u ze herstellen via de optie van Microsoft om opnieuw in te stellen. Als u dit hebt gedaan, kunt u daarna het nieuwe wachtwoord in Thunderbird ingeven.

content:
In order to use Third Party software with a Gmail account, you must first access Gmail and allow the access. If this hasn't been done then it needs to be. You says that you have allowed access but that could refer to something else so I am mentioning it.

Some email providers only allow the connection of Third Party software using an Authentication code. If you are using the most up-to-date version of TB, this shouldn't be a problem

Then access the official website on Google that lists all the server settings and check them against the fields that you have populated inside TB. The username is sometimes not what seems intuitive.

.oOo.

Um Drittanbietersoftware mit einem Gmail-Konto zu verwenden, müssen Sie zuerst auf Gmail zugreifen und den Zugriff zulassen. Wenn dies noch nicht geschehen ist, muss dies getan werden. Sie sagen, dass Sie den Zugriff zugelassen haben, aber das könnte sich auf etwas anderes beziehen, deshalb erwähne ich es.

Einige E-Mail-Anbieter erlauben die Verbindung von Drittanbietersoftware nur mit einem Authentifizierungscode. Wenn Sie die aktuellste Version von TB verwenden, sollte dies kein Problem sein.

Greifen Sie dann auf die offizielle Website von Google zu, auf der alle Servereinstellungen aufgelistet sind, und vergleichen Sie sie mit den Feldern, die Sie in TB ausgefüllt haben. Der Benutzername ist manchmal nicht das, was intuitiv erscheint.
creator: frisée

content: Versuche das zunächst mal zu deaktivieren und mache einen neuen Versuch, das Passwort zu speichern. Wenn das nicht hilft, öffne den Profilordner von TB über Hilfe > Informationen zur Fehlerbehebung > Profilordner > Ordner öffnen, TB beenden. Im Profilordner die Datei key4.db suchen und löschen, TB neu starten.

content: Hi David Thank you for the link to the configuration-options-accounts. This is exactly what I was looking for as I was struggling to get my email accounts set up. Unfortunately it seems that Thunderbird and my web hosting are not compatible, and this is why I an getting problems. We were using Outlook and the email services started to fail a couple of weeks back. I discovered that new systems were implemented by the hosting company. At that time I was using "identities" for our admin / sales / support and a few direct mailboxes for me and two other people. I was informed by the hosting company that using an alia (identities) are no longer supported, only actual mailboxes. They advised me to upgrade to Outlook 360 but I did not wish to rent software just for emails, address book and calendar, so I decided to use Thunderbird in the knowledge that it is up to date and I installed v128 Nebula. It looks like Thunderbird allows identities (aliases) but not multiple mailbox accounts and this has scuppered me! I was trying to set up multiple accounts and was confused that they would not appear in the folders pane no matter what I tried. I was very confused that after setting up the incoming server under 'Server Settings' I would go to the 'Outgoing Server (SMTP)' and do the configuration. Then I was not able to go back into the incoming server settings to set up a new account. The number of times and ways I tried to do this you would not believe! However the information you pointed me to is most useful and I think explains the problem. Your help is very much appreciated Regards Greg

content: Try these steps: - check account settiings>synchronization&storage to verify that the files can be downloaded - click File>offline>download to ensure all message content is placed on PC - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder', and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - you are now in the profile, click the imapmail folder - now, click the account folder - you should now see archive and archive.msf, copy the archive item - now, click back to profile and then click the Mail folder - Now, click the Local Folders folder and past the Archive item there - restart thunderbird and the archive should appear in Local Foldrs

content:
Is this on a single laptop with two unique users?

If you have one user and two or more accounts within Thunderbird, one for yourself and one for your husband, the email address populated by the 'From' field at the top will be the highlighted account when you click on the '+ New Message' button.

I don't know what you've checked so please look at these:

The email address associated with the account is accessed by going to Hamburger icon (top right)/Account Settings and then click on the name of the Account (at the top of the list of settings). The email address is in the right pane.

When you click on '+ New Message' to open a new window, is the email address correct in the 'From' field? If it isn't, use the drop down to amend it.

creator: Tudieb

content:
Tudie said
When new mesasage is clicked from David's account it appears to be going from him.

It will do. It may be that you're not quite grasping what I'm saying.

With ONLY the normal interface open: 1. On the lhs in the tree under '+New Message', something will be highlighted. 2. That selection is displayed on the right. 3. Let's suppose that the highlight on the left is under YOUR account. Your husband comes along and thinks 'I need to send a message' so he clicks on '+New Message' and fills in the recipient and so on. 4. Because your account is highlighted, the new message has your account as the sender and 'reply to', NOT his. And who checks that, anyway, before it goes? Even if you have separate address books. It will only ever use the sender's email address from the account that's highlighted.

Is that making it clearer? That's what I think is happening.

How To 'Screen Print' tutorial - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-do-i-create-screenshot-my-problem#w_create-a-screenshot-on-windows
creator: frisée

content:
I think the problem is that you don't have the accounts set to send on separate smtp servers that have User Names that match the sending account. For example, if gmail account A sends on the smtp for gmail account B, recipients will see messages sent from A as if they were sent from B. So replies will go to B.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438310

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
creator: sfhowes

content: Yes, you are both using the same SMTP server. - click accountsettings, then scroll down to Outgoing Servers SMTP and click - now, you should see both servers. click edit and put email address in DESCRIPTION field for easy documentation - set the proper email address on each as appropriate - now, click the account pane for each and look at bottom line where it links to SMTP server. If it isn't showing the right email address, click the dropdown menu and select the right one.

content: I imported abook.mab and impab.mab- and got all contacts. In all my "poking around" I did not do that before. Thanks- stress gone!
creator: runner4

content:
• .mab is the old format for address books in Thunderbird, so abook.mab was the old file name for Personal Address Book. Since several TB versions it has become "abook.sqlite".

runner4 said
There are a lot of *.sqlite files in the old computer's /profiles/2vsn54vh.default folder. I imported abook.sqlite to the new one. That added one more email contact from the old address book. I now have 2 of the contacts. There are several hundred still missing.

By default there are a abook.sqlite (Personal AB) and a history.sqlite (Collected Addresses) file in the profile folder. If you ever have imported an AB there might also be a impab.sqlite file. Which are the *.sqlite files in your old profile ? Maybe you had created an AB which contains most of your contacts instead of the Personal Address Book. Or did you create a CardDav address book with your Mac "Contacts" on the old MacBook? This would probably be abook-1.sqlite

content: Do you use the "Mac OS-X Address Book" in Thunderbird Address Book? If you can't determine because of the "freeze" first test would be to start TB in "Troubleshooting Mode" https://mzl.la/3AbU5jz If TB still won't load go to System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy tab and select "Contacts" in the left pane: uncheck "Thunderbird.app" . Start Thudnerbird
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Thanks for your very quick response. Unfortunately I'm still stuck with the spinning beach ball. But let me respond to your suggestions.

1. Use Mac OS-X Address Book? At one point the beach ball stopped spinning (why I do not know) and I was briefly able to access the address book part of TB. It had four "catagories": All Address Books, Personal Address Book, Mac Contacts, and Collected Addresses.

2. Again after about half an hour of beach ball, I was able to start TB in Trouble Shooting Mode. But the beach ball promptly returned.

3. Go to System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy tab and select "Contacts" in the left pane: uncheck "Thunderbird.app". I did this but there were no entries (TB or otherwise) to uncheck.

I also started my Mac in Safe Mode, but as soon as I tried to load TB the beach ball returned.

I then tried updating the OS to the very latest version of Sonoma (14.7.2) and tried all the steps above again. But no success.

Then just for the heck of it, I loaded Apple Mail, and it connected to my Gmail account with no trouble at all.

I've thought about removing TB entirely and then reinstalling it. But I don't know how to go about that or whether I could somehow save the hundreds of emails I currently have stored in TB.

I've also considered going into Recovery Mode and reloading the OS to see if that would resolve the issue. But I hesitate as I might make matters even worse.

Much as I would hate to give up TB, I am tempted to just move on and use Apple Mail instead--though I don't know how I'd get the emails currently in TB moved to Apple Mail.

By the way, I failed to mention earlier that the Mac in question has an M1 chip not an Intel chip, if that makes any difference.

Thanks again for your prompt response to my initial posting. If you have any other thoughts or suggestions, I would be happy to hear them.
creator: charlesvaughn693

content:
Update on my issue above. I have 3 Thunderbird accounts for 3 different email addresses. On checking further, it seems that the slowness is not only in deleting messages but in other functions as well, such as dragging and dropping messages to folders. However, I now see that the slowness is only with one of the TB accounts.

Still hoping for an easy fix and would appreciate any help.

Thanks
creator: Bartholo

content:
Well, I didn't receive any suggestions so I just tried a few random things and I may have gotten lucky.

As I mentioned, the "slowness" problem was in just one of my 3 TB accounts and it was concentrated in the Inbox. There would be about a 7 second delay in deleting inbox messages and also delays in, e.g., dragging and dropping messages from that Inbox.

I right-clicked on that Inbox and hit "Compact". I doubted that would do any good, especially since I'd never needed to "compact" before, plus the fact that I never have more than a small number (less than a dozen) messages in that Inbox at any given time.

But lo and behold, it seemed to do the trick. I've got all my fingers and toes crossed, but I'm no longer having the delays.

If anyone has any insight into what happened here, I'd still like to hear it.

Thanks
creator: Bartholo

content:
The bizarre behavior is that of the IMAP mail protocol, not Thunderbird. It just implements it like Microsoft Outlook does.

Select subscribe on the menu to both subscribe and unsubscribe from an online folder.

Or just go to this link https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#settings/labels and tell Google not to show the all mail folder in Thunderbird (IMAP).

Either will work, but the first will have many less gotchas down the track than turning off the folder at gmail.

lets see, you right click on the account name and you get a subscribe option. That is what the little dashed line around the account in the image indicates, it is the item with the focus.

You can go the full route via ☰ > Account settings > Select synchronization and storage in the relevant account > Advanced button

But that is a lot of clicks to do what two will do in the folder pane.
